subject: Personal Finance
title: The Fall of Lehman Brothers
description: A quick, practical guide to The Fall of Lehman Brothers.

hook.text: On September 15, 2008, Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy. It was the largest in US history.

buildup.text: Lehman was a 158-year-old investment bank, leveraged 31-to-1 and loaded with mortgage securities.

discovery.text: The government had rescued Bear Stearns months earlier. Markets assumed Lehman would be saved too.

twist.text: The government let Lehman fail. The shock froze global credit markets within hours.

climax.text: Within weeks, governments worldwide were bailing out banks to prevent total economic collapse.

punchline.text: One bank's death nearly killed the system.

quiz.question: What happened when Lehman Brothers was allowed to fail?
options: Global credit markets froze almost immediately
